adjective.description: Of, forming, or situated at the end or extremity of something.
examples: the terminal tip of the probe

adjective.description: (of a disease) predicted to lead to death, especially slowly; incurable.

noun.description: The end of a railroad or other transport route, or a station at such a point.
A point of connection for closing an electric circuit.
A device at which a user enters data or commands for a computer system and which displays the received output.

origin: Early 19th century: from Latin terminalis, from terminus end, boundary.
